results.title: The Joy Luck Club
results.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, The Joy Luck Club tells the story of two generations of Chinese women and spans from feudal China to modern America while highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

results.description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, “The Joy Luck Club” tells the story of two generations of Chinese women. Four are mothers and wives who emigrated from China to build new lives and families in the United States. The other four are their Chinese-American daughters who are struggling to define their own identities against the expectations of their mothers and the American society where they live. Wayne Wang masterfully interweaves the stories of the eight women which spans from feudal China to modern America, highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations. “The Joy Luck Club” is a beautiful film to watch, with lavish production values which make the characters’ stories even more compelling.
description_for_label: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, “The Joy Luck Club” tells the story of two generations of Chinese women. Four are mothers and wives who emigrated from China to build new lives and families in the United States. The other four are their Chinese-American daughters who are struggling to define their own identities against the expectations of their mothers and the American society where they live. Wayne Wang masterfully interweaves the stories of the eight women which spans from feudal China to modern America, highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations. “The Joy Luck Club” is a beautiful film to watch, with lavish production values which make the characters’ stories even more compelling.

results.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
results.brief_description: Robert Durst, scion of one of New York’s billionaire real estate families, has been accused of three murders but never convicted. During interviews with filmmaker Andrew Jarecki, he reveals secrets of the case that baffled authorities for 30 years.

constellations_other.name: Presumption of guilt
constellations_other.description: A Constellation looking at true crime documentaries, the nature of innocence and prejudice.

results.title_for_label: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
results.description: Robert Durst, scion of one of New York’s billionaire real estate families, has been accused of three murders but never convicted. Brilliant, reclusive, and the subject of relentless media scrutiny, he’s never spoken publicly—until now. During interviews with Andrew Jarecki, he reveals secrets of the case that baffled authorities for 30 years. In 2010, Jarecki made the narrative film All Good Things based on the infamous story of Robert Durst. After Durst saw the film, he contacted Jarecki wanting to tell his story. What began as a feature documentary ultimately became a six-part series as more and more of his incredible story was revealed.
description_for_label: Robert Durst, scion of one of New York’s billionaire real estate families, has been accused of three murders but never convicted. Brilliant, reclusive, and the subject of relentless media scrutiny, he’s never spoken publicly—until now. During interviews with Andrew Jarecki, he reveals secrets of the case that baffled authorities for 30 years. In 2010, Jarecki made the narrative film All Good Things based on the infamous story of Robert Durst. After Durst saw the film, he contacted Jarecki wanting to tell his story. What began as a feature documentary ultimately became a six-part series as more and more of his incredible story was revealed.

results.title: The Jazz Singer
results.brief_description: The Jazz Singer is a 1927 American musical drama film directed by Alan Crosland. It is the first feature-length motion picture with not only a synchronised recorded music score but also lip-synchronous singing and speech in several isolated sequences.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

results.description: A young Jewish man is torn between tradition and individuality when his old-fashioned family objects to his career as a jazz singer. This is the first full length feature film to use synchronised sound, and is the original film musical.
description_for_label: A young Jewish man is torn between tradition and individuality when his old-fashioned family objects to his career as a jazz singer. This is the first full length feature film to use synchronised sound, and is the original film musical.

results.title: The Irishman
results.brief_description: Pennsylvania, 1956. Frank Sheeran, a war veteran of Irish origin who works as a truck driver, accidentally meets mobster Russell Bufalino. Once Frank becomes his trusted man, Bufalino sends him to Chicago with the task of helping Jimmy Hoffa, a powerful union leader related to organized crime, with whom Frank will maintain a close friendship for nearly twenty years.

results.title: The Invisible Man
results.brief_description: The Invisible Man is a 1933 American pre-Code science fiction horror film directed by James Whale. Based on H. G. Wells’ 1897 science fiction novel The Invisible Man and produced by Universal Pictures, the film stars Claude Rains, in his first American screen appearance, - WIKI
results.description: Working in Dr. Cranley’s laboratory, scientist Jack Griffin was always given the latitude to conduct some of his own experiments. His sudden departure, however, has Cranley’s daughter Flora worried about him. Griffin has taken a room at the nearby Lion’s Head Inn, hoping to reverse an experiment he conducted on himself that made him invisible. But the experimental drug has also warped his mind, making him aggressive and dangerous. He’s prepared to do whatever it takes to restore his appearance.
description_for_label: Working in Dr. Cranley’s laboratory, scientist Jack Griffin was always given the latitude to conduct some of his own experiments. results.title: The Invisible Man
results.creator_credit: Jason Blum, Blumhouse Productions, Universal Pictures, Goalpost Pictures, Leigh Whannell, Emily Seresin, Alex Holmes and Kylie du Fresne
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2020
results.brief_description: When Cecilia’s abusive ex takes his own life and leaves her his fortune, she suspects his death was a hoax. As a series of coincidences turn lethal, Cecilia works to prove that she is being hunted by someone nobody can see.

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jason Blum, Blumhouse Productions, Universal Pictures, Goalpost Pictures, Leigh Whannell, Emily Seresin, Alex Holmes and Kylie du Fresne

results.title: The Innocent Man
results.brief_description: In a story that gained national attention with John Grisham’s best-selling non-fiction book on the subject, the documentary series The Innocent Man focuses on two murders that shook the small town of Ada, Oklahoma, in the 1980s — and the controversial events that followed.

constellations_other.name: Presumption of guilt
constellations_other.description: A Constellation looking at true crime documentaries, the nature of innocence and prejudice.

results.title: The Impossible
results.creator_credit: Summit Entertainment, Apaches Entertainment, Canal+ España, Instituto de la Cinematografía y de las Artes Audiovisuales, Institut Valenciã de Cinematografia (IVAC), Mediaset España, La Trini, Generalitat Valenciana, Telecinco Cinema, Sparka Lee Hall, Álvaro Augustín, Belén Atienza, Ghislain Barrois, J. A. Bayona, Sergio G. Sánchez, Maria Reyes and Anna Bingemann
results.headline_credit: Spain and United States of America, 2012
results.brief_description: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand only for the devastating Indian Ocean tsunami to strike.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Summit Entertainment, Apaches Entertainment, Canal+ España, Instituto de la Cinematografía y de las Artes Audiovisuales, Institut Valenciã de Cinematografia (IVAC), Mediaset España, La Trini, Generalitat Valenciana, Telecinco Cinema, Sparka Lee Hall, Álvaro Augustín, Belén Atienza, Ghislain Barrois, J. A. Bayona, Sergio G. Sánchez, Maria Reyes and Anna Bingemann
results.description: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand. But the day after Christmas, the idyllic holiday turns into an incomprehensible nightmare when a terrifying roar rises from the depths of the sea, followed by a wall of black water that devours everything in its path. Though Maria and her family face their darkest hour, unexpected displays of kindness and courage ameliorate their terror.
description_for_label: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand. results.title: The Imitation Game
results.creator_credit: Bristol Automotive, Black Bear Pictures, Maria Djurkovic, Sammy Sheldon, Morten Tyldum, Graham Moore, Teddy Schwarzman, Nora Grossman and Ido Ostrowsky
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Based on the real life story of legendary cryptanalyst Alan Turing, the film portrays the nail-biting race against time by Turing and his brilliant team of code-breakers at Britain’s top-secret Government Code and Cypher School at Bletchley Park, during the darkest days of World War II.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.title: The Idiots
results.headline_credit: Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands and Sweden, 1998
results.brief_description: With his first Dogma-95 film director Lars von Trier opens up a completely new film platform. With a mix of home-video and documentary styles the film tells the story of a group of young people who have decided to get to know their “inner-idiots” and thus not only facing and breaking their outer appearance but also their inner.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.
